poem:
Strife of the Land

They march in shadows,
nameless workers
beneath the American dream.

Ports haunt them,
silent as tombstones;
wrath rolls in pewter clouds.

Trump stirs the pot,
a kaleidoscope of cost
weighs heavy:
profits stolen,
hearts emptied,
justice whispered on the wind
like a prayer never answered.
